SENT.plain: CSF dynamics were determined as a function of intracranial pressure in patients with pseudotumor cerebri
Servocontrolled variable rate lumbar infusions were used to determine net CSF-absorptive capacities and resting pressures in 10 patients; serial studies were done in 5 of the patients
Nearly all of the patients had abnormally low CSF-absorptive capacities
On the other hand, marked elevations in resting pressure were not a constant feature of the disease
Concurrent changes in the cerebrovascular bed could introduce errors into this manometric determination of CSF dynamics; the significance of this potential artifact is examined
The results of this study suggest that the CSF compartment may be of etiological importance in the pathophysiology of pseudotumor cerebri
